segment.source: How to Apply Virtual Machine Settings to a MED-V Workspace
segment.target: How to Apply Virtual Machine Settings to a MED-V Workspace

segment.source: How to Apply Virtual Machine Settings to a MED-V Workspace
segment.target: How to Apply Virtual Machine Settings to a MED-V Workspace

segment.source: How to Apply Virtual Machine Settings to a MED-V Workspace
segment.target: How to Apply Virtual Machine Settings to a MED-V Workspace

segment.source: Every MED-V workspace must have a Microsoft Virtual PC image associated with it.
segment.target: Every MED-V workspace must have a Microsoft Virtual PC image associated with it.

segment.source: The virtual machine settings enable you to assign a Virtual PC image as well as set other virtual machine properties.
segment.target: The virtual machine settings enable you to assign a Virtual PC image as well as set other virtual machine properties.

segment.source: All virtual machine settings are configured in the Policy module, on the Virtual Machine Settings tab.
segment.target: All virtual machine settings are configured in the Policy module, on the Virtual Machine Settings tab.

segment.source: To apply virtual machine settings to a MED-V workspace
segment.target: To apply virtual machine settings to a MED-V workspace

segment.source: Click the MED-V workspace to configure.
segment.target: Click the MED-V workspace to configure.

segment.source: Configure the virtual machine properties as described in the following table.
segment.target: Configure the virtual machine properties as described in the following table.

segment.source: On the Policy menu, select Commit.
segment.target: On the Policy menu, select Commit.

segment.source: Virtual Machine Properties
segment.target: Virtual Machine Properties

segment.source: Property Description Virtual Machine Settings
segment.target: Property Description Virtual Machine Settings

segment.source: Assigned Image
segment.target: Assigned Image

segment.source: The actual Microsoft Virtual PC image assigned to the MED-V workspace.
segment.target: The actual Microsoft Virtual PC image assigned to the MED-V workspace.

segment.source: The menu provides a list of all available Virtual PC images.
segment.target: The menu provides a list of all available Virtual PC images.

segment.source: The following image types are in the Active image list:
segment.target: The following image types are in the Active image list:

segment.source: Local test images—Images on the local computer that are not yet packed.
segment.target: Local test images—Images on the local computer that are not yet packed.

segment.source: These image names are followed by the word “test” in parentheses (test) and are for testing purposes only.
segment.target: These image names are followed by the word “test” in parentheses (test) and are for testing purposes only.

segment.source: Local packed images—Packed images on the local computer.
segment.target: Local packed images—Packed images on the local computer.

segment.source: These images are followed by the word “local” in parentheses (local) and cannot be downloaded by clients until the administrator uploads them to the server.
segment.target: These images are followed by the word “local” in parentheses (local) and cannot be downloaded by clients until the administrator uploads them to the server.

segment.source: A local image can be selected if you are creating a package that will be distributed to the client via removable media (such as USB or DVD).
segment.target: A local image can be selected if you are creating a package that will be distributed to the client via removable media (such as USB or DVD).

segment.source: Packed images on server—Images that are on the server and are available for download by clients.
segment.target: Packed images on server—Images that are on the server and are available for download by clients.

segment.source: Click Refresh to refresh the images list.
segment.target: Click Refresh to refresh the images list.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Each MED-V workspace image can only be used by one Windows user.
segment.target: Each MED-V workspace image can only be used by one Windows user.

segment.source: Workspace is persistent
segment.target: Workspace is persistent

segment.source: Select this check box to configure the MED-V workspace as persistent.
segment.target: Select this check box to configure the MED-V workspace as persistent.

segment.source: In a persistent MED-V workspace, when the MED-V workspace is stopped, changes and additions to the MED-V workspace are saved in the MED-V workspace.
segment.target: In a persistent MED-V workspace, when the MED-V workspace is stopped, changes and additions to the MED-V workspace are saved in the MED-V workspace.

segment.source: For a Domain MED-V workspace, this option must be selected.
segment.target: For a Domain MED-V workspace, this option must be selected.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: This setting should not be changed after a MED-V workspace is deployed to users.
segment.target: This setting should not be changed after a MED-V workspace is deployed to users.

segment.source: Shut down the VM when stopping the Workspace
segment.target: Shut down the VM when stopping the Workspace

segment.source: Select this check box to shut down the virtual machine when stopping the MED-V workspace.
segment.target: Select this check box to shut down the virtual machine when stopping the MED-V workspace.

segment.source: If this check box is cleared, at the completion of each session, the virtual machine is not shut down but instead takes a snapshot of the virtual machine.
segment.target: If this check box is cleared, at the completion of each session, the virtual machine is not shut down but instead takes a snapshot of the virtual machine.

segment.source: Upon the initiation of a new session, Windows starts from the snapshot (that is, Windows does not restart and no login is required).
segment.target: Upon the initiation of a new session, Windows starts from the snapshot (that is, Windows does not restart and no login is required).

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: This property is enabled only if Workspace is persistent is selected.
segment.target: This property is enabled only if Workspace is persistent is selected.

segment.source: Logon to Windows in VM using MED-V credentials (SSO)
segment.target: Logon to Windows in VM using MED-V credentials (SSO)

segment.source: Select this check box to log in to Windows on the virtual machine by using the MED-V credentials entered when logging in to MED-V client.
segment.target: Select this check box to log in to Windows on the virtual machine by using the MED-V credentials entered when logging in to MED-V client.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: This property is enabled only when Workspace is persistent is selected.
segment.target: This property is enabled only when Workspace is persistent is selected.

segment.source: Workspace is revertible
segment.target: Workspace is revertible

segment.source: Select this check box to configure the MED-V workspace as revertible.
segment.target: Select this check box to configure the MED-V workspace as revertible.

segment.source: In a revertible MED-V workspace, at the completion of each session (that is, when the user stops the MED-V workspace), the MED-V workspace reverts to the original state it was in during deployment.
segment.target: In a revertible MED-V workspace, at the completion of each session (that is, when the user stops the MED-V workspace), the MED-V workspace reverts to the original state it was in during deployment.

segment.source: No changes or additions that the user made are saved on the MED-V workspace between sessions.
segment.target: No changes or additions that the user made are saved on the MED-V workspace between sessions.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: This setting should not be changed after a MED-V workspace is deployed to users.
segment.target: This setting should not be changed after a MED-V workspace is deployed to users.

segment.source: Synchronize Workspace time zone with host
segment.target: Synchronize Workspace time zone with host

segment.source: Select this check box to synchronize the time zone in the MED-V workspace with the host.
segment.target: Select this check box to synchronize the time zone in the MED-V workspace with the host.

segment.source: The synchronization works differently depending on whether the MED-V workspace is persistent or revertible, as follows:
segment.target: The synchronization works differently depending on whether the MED-V workspace is persistent or revertible, as follows:

segment.source: In a persistent MED-V workspace, the time zone first tries to synchronize with the server.
segment.target: In a persistent MED-V workspace, the time zone first tries to synchronize with the server.

segment.source: If that fails, it synchronizes with the host.
segment.target: If that fails, it synchronizes with the host.

segment.source: In a revertible MED-V workspace, the time zone synchronizes with the host.
segment.target: In a revertible MED-V workspace, the time zone synchronizes with the host.

segment.source: Lock Settings
segment.target: Lock Settings

segment.source: Lock the Workspace on host standby/hibernate event
segment.target: Lock the Workspace on host standby/hibernate event

segment.source: Select this check box to automatically lock the MED-V workspace when the host computer goes into standby or hibernate.
segment.target: Select this check box to automatically lock the MED-V workspace when the host computer goes into standby or hibernate.

segment.source: Lock the Workspace after
segment.target: Lock the Workspace after

segment.source: Select this check box to lock the MED-V workspace when the MED-V workspace is idle for a specified period of time.
segment.target: Select this check box to lock the MED-V workspace when the MED-V workspace is idle for a specified period of time.

segment.source: When selected, the number box is enabled.
segment.target: When selected, the number box is enabled.

segment.source: Enter the number of minutes of idle time before locking the MED-V workspace.
segment.target: Enter the number of minutes of idle time before locking the MED-V workspace.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The idle time refers to the MED-V workspace applications (not the host applications).
segment.target: The idle time refers to the MED-V workspace applications (not the host applications).

segment.source: Image Update Settings
segment.target: Image Update Settings

segment.source: Keep only
segment.target: Keep only

segment.source: Select this check box to limit the number of old image versions to keep.
segment.target: Select this check box to limit the number of old image versions to keep.

segment.source: When selected, the number box is enabled.
segment.target: When selected, the number box is enabled.

segment.source: Enter the number of old versions to keep.
segment.target: Enter the number of old versions to keep.

segment.source: Suggest update when a new version is available
segment.target: Suggest update when a new version is available

segment.source: Select this check box to suggest (but not force) an update when a new version of the image is available.
segment.target: Select this check box to suggest (but not force) an update when a new version of the image is available.

segment.source: Clients should use Trim Transfer when downloading images for this Workspace
segment.target: Clients should use Trim Transfer when downloading images for this Workspace

segment.source: Select this check box to enable Trim Transfer (for more information, see MED-V Trim Transfer Technology) when downloading images associated with this MED-V workspace.
segment.target: Select this check box to enable Trim Transfer (for more information, see MED-V Trim Transfer Technology) when downloading images associated with this MED-V workspace.

segment.source: If this check box is cleared, the full image will be downloaded.
segment.target: If this check box is cleared, the full image will be downloaded.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Trim Transfer requires indexing the hard drive, which might take a considerable amount of time.
segment.target: Trim Transfer requires indexing the hard drive, which might take a considerable amount of time.

segment.source: It is recommended to use Trim Transfer when indexing the hard drive is more efficient than downloading the new image version, such as when downloading an image version that is similar to the existing version.
segment.target: It is recommended to use Trim Transfer when indexing the hard drive is more efficient than downloading the new image version, such as when downloading an image version that is similar to the existing version.
